revised_title: A Study of Bactericidal Power in Human Blood under Aerobic and Anaerobic Conditions
tldr: This article describes a method for measuring the bactericidal power of small samples of blood under aerobic and anaerobic conditions. The author explains how to standardize bacterial cultures, prepare dilutions, and determine the number of living bacteria in a sample. The study focuses on the bactericidal effect of human blood under different conditions and highlights the importance of aseptic precautions and timely testing for accurate results.
